text: Giovanni Tommaso Perrone (1601 – 16 November 1677) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Nicastro (1639–1677). (in Latin) ==Biography== Giovanni Tommaso Perrone was born in Rossano, Italy in 1601. On 11 April 1639, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Urban VIII as Bishop of Nicastro. On 25 April 1639, he was consecrated bishop by Alessandro Cesarini (iuniore), Cardinal-Deacon of Sant'Eustachio, with Tommaso Carafa, Bishop Emeritus of Vulturara e Montecorvino, and Lorenzo della Robbia, Bishop of Fiesole, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Nicastro until his death on 16 November 1677. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th- century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Urban VIII Category:1601 births Category:1677 deaths
